alert.note: Alert for Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 9:09PM CDT until August 20 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT SATURDAY FOR SOUTHWESTERN MUSCATINE COUNTY... At 909 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen, with a rainfall total of 4 inches measured on the west side of Conesville around 730 PM. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Conesville and Cranston. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
